data.title: Clicking on link doesn't seem to do anything
data.body:
Version 1.8.0-insider
Commit e0871329738682651367be4e8a618912ad693e03
Date 2016-12-08T07:04:29.620Z

Test on Linux and Mac

```html
<html>
	<head>
		<script type="text/javascript" src="foo.js"></script>
	</head>
	<body>
	</body>
</html>
```

- note that "foo.js" is undelined
- try to click on it. Nothing happens

links.getLinkOccurence doesn't seem to find anything

data.title: Allow to show diff of current file to unsaved changes
data.body:
### Feature request

at the moment vscode use undo/redo history to tell if the file has pending changes.
it would be nice that it can also execute an in-memory diff (with of course an upper limit on the size of file specified in the config) between the last saved copy and the actual one in the editor to understand if the two copies are really different, leaving the undo/redo history.

what do you think about this guys?

data.title: Git clone input message should remain same always
data.body:
Verifying #16583

After adding validation to git clone URL

- Initially input shows following
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/21009421/bb78ac7e-bd46-11e6-9494-69c7b3091aff.png)

- Once I enter some invalid string
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/21010908/f84171ce-bd4e-11e6-8f2d-1723d3b16f19.png)

- Cleared the input
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/21010932/06bdf9d4-bd4f-11e6-8491-e22b6bedb469.png)

I think the message under should always show 
`Provide a valid git repository URL. (Press Enter to confirm or Esc to cancel)`
Outline of the input box should be blue when empty and red when not valid

data.title: Just my code: introduce a magic path for core modules
data.body:
Just my code: introduce a magic path for excluding/including core modules, e.g.:
```ts
    "skipFiles": [
        "core_modules/*.js"
    ]
```

In addition we should use the same magic path when showing core modules in the CALLSTACK view. This will fix the bogus path problem #16913.

data.title: Changing a decoration's options is no longer reflected in the view
data.body:
@jrieken knows how to verify.

Cases:
* current find highlight
* last snippet highlight changes the class name from a decoration with border to one without border when it expands

data.title: Having an invalid configuration in compound behaves randomly
data.body:
Verifying #16614

- Open launch.json in VS Code
- Put following compound configuration
```
"compounds": [
		{
			"name": "Compound1",
			"configurations": [
				"abcs"
			]
		}
	]
```
- Select above compound from the dropdown
- It runs Mocha unit tests

data.title: Overwritting closing statement / braces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (a8d5b9281e2118c2a10098098ddaac949ce69fe0, 2016-12-06T07:11:10.946Z)
- OS Version: Windows_7
- Extensions:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type a " or ' or } or ) 
2. Type the same character before that character e.g. left arrow + "
(only occurs on closing)

I understand that is some cases this is a feature. But it is only a feature when VS code auto inserts the closing symbol, therefore it should only overwrite when a auto-insert occurs.

Overwriting closing statements when it was not supposed to has caused errors for me more than a few times. There is no reason for it to overwrite unless there was a auto-insert.

- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open terminal integred
2.  Press Tab many times to next files


See GIF:

![20161208_091540](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5774595/21008143/89f5c4a8-bd27-11e6-9687-f2bfb727324f.gif)

data.title: Source location hover in CALLSTACK view shows bogus path for internal modules
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 Insiders

The source path starts with the (internal) variable reference used in the debug protocol: 
![2016-12-08_12-09-22](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/21007884/44868e9e-bd3f-11e6-8dc6-a11047c4d5e5.png)

We should find a better path root for this.
Ideally we should use a 'magic world' that could be used in the 'Just my code' feature to filter those modules (see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16918).
But the VS Code frontend should not hardcode this.

data.title: Seperate File Uploading in Marketplace for insiders
data.body:
Hi,

There should be another tab in the upload new items when publishers does upload their extension. 
Which should be available only to insiders, so extension writers dont have to upload the package.json file again and again in order to publish for insiders separately. 

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8774556/21073021/4c8ae0c8-bef6-11e6-8cd6-14fc5005951d.PNG)

To interact with insiders separately the following things can be done.
1. Extension writers should always upload the newer version for insiders compared to normal build release in that tab.
2. Extension page should show the extension version for insiders in the left side below to owner information.
3. Extension writers will have an option to release that insiders build to normal build in just one click as insiders build will always be newer than normal so writes than use that method to update.
4. When the normal build version matches either by publishing new build or transfer from insiders build like in step 3, if its version is equal to insiders build verison or newer than insiders build- this extension insiders build should be removed.


**Aim**
Extension writers can upload two version at once, one for insider and one for normal and transfer the insider build version to normal version in one click.

_Its just an idea can be further extend or improved._

Thanks

data.title: Add cursors to end line should not be in selection menu
data.body:
Selection menu > add cursors to end lines

This feature does not do anything 90% of the time and is a pro feature which should not be in the selection menu.
We should remove it from there imho

If we want to make the users aware of such commands we shuold write a blog post and bloat the menu. Having a smaller menu is better for start as it is always easier to add stuff than to remove.

data.title: [regression] Cannot navigate from output panel to editor anymore
data.body:
When having a hygiene fail in the precommit hook, I would navigate to the file using ctrl+click in the output editor. This appears to be no longer working for me.

The hover shows I can ctrl+click, but it has no effect:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/21005067/a3a520ea-bd33-11e6-9c5a-d5d6dbe868cb.png)

data.title: Support to navigate to the extended jsconfig/tsconfig.json
data.body:
TS now support `extends` in the tsconfig.json file see below for an example from:
https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/What's-new-in-TypeScript#configuration-inheritance


![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/21004741/3b8cdf58-bd32-11e6-9c86-68f488174879.png)


It would be nice when the referenced file is validated (should be provided by TS) and the tsconfig.json editor  supports to navigate to the referenced file.

// CC @kieferrm

data.title: Open Output window to the side?
data.body:
I develop on a laptop with a small widescreen monitor. I use the output window to display test output.

Having it open at the bottom of the monitor means that I have lots of empty space to the right in both my code window and my output window.

Surely it must be possible to open the output window to the side?

data.title: VS debug console does not debug Destructuring assignments
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2 
- OS Version: Windows 8.1
- Node: v6.9.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. 
Create an index.js file containing the following code:

```
let [,, a,b] = [0,1,2,3];
console.log(a);
console.log(b);
```

2. 

Use the default created launch.json for debuggin in VS debug console, example of launch.json

   ```
     {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}\\index.js",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "args": [ "/test.css", "/test.json" ]
        },
```
3. 

Start debugging using VS debug console ("Launch Program"), at first line an  error is thrown
`
TypeError: Cannot read property 'next' of undefined`

Basically I am not able to debug a Destructuring assignment

data.title: Disable text file backups when files.autoSave is afterDelay
Support for toggling case of selection along the lines of IntelliJ

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
IntelliJ allows the user to toggle the case of text selection to upper/lowercase with a single action called `Toggle Case`.

Once you select text & apply this action via shortcut, it converts the selection to uppercase by default, if you press the shortcut it again, the selected text would be converted to lowercase.

Currently uppercase & lowercase are implemented as separate actions.

It would be good to have a `Toggle case` action so that user need to remember just one shortcut instead of two different shortcuts to toggle case

Reference:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3776
